shared_text:
Kaj O'Mara KCRG
September 6 at 9:41 AM ·

The next four days will be quite the meteorological event to cover!! Tough to believe at 9:40am here on Sunday, but yeah...this afternoon is going to get very warm, very fast! Then, tomorrow we drop and tomorrow night, we drop more, especially once the rain sets in.

Wind chills in the 30s...possible. Turning on your furnace in 2-3 days...possible. Record cold afternoon temperatures Tue/Wed...likely.

As a meteorologist, I do not recall a weather pattern this bananas since I started doing this. While September is notorious for ups and down...this is really something. Let's see how it all goes!

I've had a lot of people asking if we need anything to start the year at English Valleys Elementary.

Here are a few items that we could use:

1) Bottled Water and/or New Refillable Water Bottles - Due to COVID-19 restrictions, our communal drinking fountains will be turned off.

We're asking all students to bring a reusable water bottle each day - and then take it home to be sanitized at night.

We'd like some cases of bottled water for students who forget to bring their water bottles back to school AND we'd also like some new refillable water bottles for students who may not have their own.

2) Travel Sized Tissues - We've always asked students to bring tissue boxes to school on the first day.

This year, we'd like to provide students with travel pack tissues to keep individually in their desks.

You can drop off any donations to the school starting on August 13th when the office fully reopens. Just ring the buzzer on the side of the main entrance and someone will meet you!

Thanks for all that you do to support the school!

#BearStrong

The Linder crew went live on Amanda's Beauty and made homemade Play Dough this afternoon. It turned out perfectly and we pulled out some rolling pins and cookie cutters. 🥳

You need:
-1 cup flour
-1/2 cup salt
-2 tbsp cream of tartar
-1 tbsp oil
-1 cup boiling water
-Food coloring

1. Combine flour, salt, cream of tartar.. mix
2. Add oil... mix
3. Mix a few drops of food coloring in the boiling water
4. Dump water into the mixture and mix well until no longer sticky
5. Store in plastic wrap or baggie

shared_text:
Caleb Lewis is with Edwin Lewis.
February 21 at 11:27 AM ·

Most wins since 2001, 1st Postseason win since 2011.

Season came to a rough end last night. Took some time and sleep to properly reflect. We’ve been in the lowest times over the years at EV. Went through a 46 game losing streak and this group broke it last year. Since that game the competitive turn around and fight has been undeniable. To the outside looking in 9-13 looks average.

But there is so many things it took to get just to point: a group of players that allowed me to coach hard, a former player turned into an assistant and a leader, the will to keep going when things continued to be tough, the confidence to believe in your team and school when you’ve never won consistently, being able to play with 6 guys, having a full JV group after not having one for 2 years, having supportive families, playing with class and sportsmanship, and having big crowds this year.

We will push for more in the offseason and next season. We won’t forget where we’ve been and remember what it’s like to be on the bottom. And what it takes daily to rise towards the top.
